name: Squid Ink ALog
description: This Squid Ink Arroz Caldo is a 'Healthyfied' version of the classic Filipino congee. It is packed with high-protein ingredients such as squid rings and octopus legs, low in sodium, and contains high-fiber components like 율무 (Job's Tears) and cauliflower. Perfect for anyone looking for healthy recipes that do not compromise on taste and texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the 율무 (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the 율무 (Job's Tears) in a pot of boiling water until tender, about 20 minutes, then drain and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the red onion and bell pepper. Mince the garlic and ginger root. Cut the cauliflower into small florets. Slice the squid rings and octopus legs into bite-sized pieces. Cut the hard-boiled egg into quarters.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, sauté the red onion, bell pepper, garlic, and ginger in a bit of oil until softened, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Add the squid ink, squid rings, and octopus legs to the pot. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked 율무 (Job's Tears) and cauliflower to the pot. Pour enough water to cover all the ingredients. Bring to a boil and then simmer for about 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Continue to simmer for another 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot, garnishing each bowl with a quarter of a hard-boiled egg.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
